pluralize() is duplicated in 3 locations (identified in code review).

```typescript
// packages/core/src/utils/pluralize.ts
const irregulars: Record<string, string> = {
  person: 'people',
  child: 'children',
  // ... add more as needed
}

export function pluralize(word: string): string {
  if (irregulars[word]) return irregulars[word]
  if (word.endsWith('s')) return word
  if (word.endsWith('y')) return word.slice(0, -1) + 'ies'
  return word + 's'
}

export function singularize(word: string): string {
  // Inverse of pluralize
  const inverse = Object.entries(irregulars)
    .find(([_, plural]) => plural === word)
  if (inverse) return inverse[0]
  
  if (word.endsWith('ies')) return word.slice(0, -3) + 'y'
  if (word.endsWith('s')) return word.slice(0, -1)
  return word
}
```
